If ETH went up by 10x, that would make the system less affordable sure, but then *interest* in ethereum going up by 10x would make fees less affordable by a similar amount anway.

For example, suppose that we claimed that the Ethereum state was "the world hard drive" with a maximum theoretical capacity of 120 terabytes (assume no sharding); you would need to lock up 0.001 ETH to fill up 1 KB of state (now ~$5 for a medium-sized contract).
